divs: sighting detailswhat really made me sit up and look at the sky was the blazing speed of what could have been a silvery pointed vehicle--if it was a plane, it was faster than any normal planes. the "con" trail was also unusual. this vehicle would "spurt" pieces of con trail....then no con trail would appear for 3\4 seconds. again, a con trail would appear, just one power source from what i could see, more con-trail and then nothing again. this happened across the horizon in a matter of seconds. not a commercial plane for sure. as the vehicle was zipping by across lake michigan, it just blanked out--no more con-trail--no more pointed type vehicle. i'd guess the compass course would have been about 220 degrees, not quite straight west--a notch to the south. amazing speed could have been some type of ram-jet, "if it was a military vehicle. ben mocini grandville, mich.
trends: There have been 45 other sightings in Grand Rapids
There were no other sightings in Grand Rapids on or around May 7th 2009
Summary: A "very" fast "puffy bursts from I could see @ 40K feet--moving from east to west--20 degrees south.
